original: de'i phyir de'i mjug thogs su gzugs med par gtogs pa'i nyon mongs pa can mi 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de'i phyir de'i mjug thogs su gzugs med par gtogs pa'i nyon mongs pa can mi 'byung ngo //
translated: Therefore, a formless realm afflicted mind does not arise immediately after that mind.

original: sa gzhan gyi ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: sa gzhan gyi ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Also, an unobscured neutral mind of another level does not arise immediately after it.

original: de ni skye ba dang snyoms par 'jug pa na de'i mjug thogs su mi srid do //
analyzed: de ni skye ba dang snyoms par 'jug pa na de'i mjug thogs su mi srid do //
translated: That is not possible immediately after the mind of emanation or the mind of entry into meditative attainment.

original: ma bsgribs pa ni gsum las so //
analyzed: ma bsgribs pa ni gsum las so //
translated: An unobscured mind arises from three.

original: zhes bya ba la de ni nyid mtshams sbyor ba'i sems su mi rung zhing /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la de ni nyid mtshams sbyor ba'i sems su mi rung zhing /
translated: That mind is not suitable as the mind of entry into reincarnation.

original: 'dod pa'i khams kyi sbyor ba las byung ba yang ma yin la /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams kyi sbyor ba las byung ba yang ma yin la /
translated: Also, it is not a mind of emanation of the desire realm.

original: slob pa dang mi slob pa dang / gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i ldang ba'i sems kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: slob pa dang mi slob pa dang / gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i ldang ba'i sems kyang ma yin te /
translated: It is not a mind of entry into meditative attainment of the formless realm.

original: de'i phyir rang gis pa gsum las yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir rang gis pa gsum las yin no //
translated: Therefore, it arises from three of its own level.

original: de las drug ste zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de las drug ste zhes bya ba la /
translated: Six arise from that.

original: nying mtshams sbyor ba'i tshe 'dod pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa can dag dang / gzugs med pa na spyod pa'o //
analyzed: nying mtshams sbyor ba'i tshe 'dod pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa can dag dang / gzugs med pa na spyod pa'o //
translated: At the time of entry into reincarnation, it arises from two afflicted minds of the desire realm and one of the formless realm.

original: sbyor ba las byung ba'i phyir slob pa dang mi slob pa dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i dge ba dag kyang de las mi 'byung ba ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pas gzir bar mi byed pas 'dod pa na spyod pa'i dge ba yang de'i mjugüîΩthogs su mi 'byung ngo //

translated: Also, since it is not derived from preparation, it does not arise from virtuous minds derived from preparation or from unobscured neutral minds of the form realm.

original: skye ba dang snyoms par 'jug pa nas gong ma dang 'og ma pa'i ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa yang de'i mjug thogs su mi srid do //
analyzed: skye ba dang snyoms par 'jug pa nas gong ma dang 'og ma pa'i ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa yang de'i mjug thogs su mi srid do //
translated: Also, it is impossible for it to arise from unobscured neutral minds of higher or lower levels at birth or entry into meditative attainment.

original: gzugs med pa'ang de'i tshul lo //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gzugs med pa'ang de'i tshul lo // zhes bya ba la /
translated: The formless realm is similar to that.

original: de ni skye ba dang snyoms par 'jug pa'i tshe sa 'og ma pa'i dge ba la sogs pa rnams las srid pa ma yin la /
analyzed: de ni skye ba dang snyoms par 'jug pa'i tshe sa 'og ma pa'i dge ba la sogs pa rnams las srid pa ma yin la /
translated: At birth and entry into meditative attainment, it is impossible for it to arise from virtuous minds and so on of lower levels.

original: slob pa dang mi slob pa dag gi mjug thogs su yang ma yin te /
analyzed: slob pa dang mi slob pa dag gi mjug thogs su yang ma yin te /
translated: Also, it does not arise from learner or nonlearner minds.

original: de'i phyir rang gis pa gsum kho na las 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de'i phyir rang gis pa gsum kho na las 'byung ngo //
translated: Therefore it arises from three of its own level alone.

original: sa 'og ma pa'i nyon mongs pa can rnams dang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sa 'og ma pa'i nyon mongs pa can rnams dang zhes bya ba la /
translated: Afflicted states of lower level.

original: nying mtshams sbyor ba'i tshe 'dod pa dang gzugs kyi khams rnams so //
analyzed: nying mtshams sbyor ba'i tshe 'dod pa dang gzugs kyi khams rnams so //
translated: At the time of rebirth, these are desire realm and form realm states.

original: @248b gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i dge ba'i sems las ni sems dgu ste /
analyzed: @248b gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i dge ba'i sems las ni sems dgu ste /

original: rang gi sa pa gsum dang / ldang ba'i tshe gzugs su gtogs pa'i dge ba dang / nying mtshams sbyor ba'i tshe sa 'og ma pa'i nyon mongs pa can rnams dang / snyoms par 'jug pa'i tshe slob pa dang mi slob pa'o //üîΩ'dod pa na spyod pa'i dge ba dang / 'dod pa dang gzugs na spyod pa'i ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa ma gtogs so zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rang gi sa pa gsum dang / ldang ba'i tshe gzugs su gtogs pa'i dge ba dang / nying mtshams sbyor ba'i tshe sa 'og ma pa'i nyon mongs pa can rnams dang / snyoms par 'jug pa'i tshe slob pa dang mi slob pa'o // 'dod pa na spyod pa'i dge ba dang / 'dod pa dang gzugs na spyod pa'i ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa ma gtogs so zhes bya ba la /
translated: Three of its own level, a virtuous mind of the form realm at the time of rising from meditative attainment, afflicted minds of lower levels at the time of rebirth and learner and nonlearner minds at the time of entering meditative attainment.üîΩExcept for a virtuous mind of the desire realm and unobscured neutral minds of the desire realm and form realm.

original: 'dod pa'i khams la gzugs med pa'i khams bskal pa yin pas de'i sa pa'i dge ba ni gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i ldang pa'i sems kyang ma yin te /

translated: The formless realm is distant from the desire realm because it is a separate realm. Therefore, a virtuous mind of the formless realm is neither a mind of arising from meditative attainment of the desire realm nor a mind of entering meditative attainment of the desire realm.

original: des na de'i mjug thogs su mi rigs so //
analyzed: des na de'i mjug thogs su mi rigs so //
translated: Therefore, it is not reasonable to posit that as its result.

original: ji ltar 'dod par gtogs pa'i sprul pa'i sems gzugs na spyod pa'i sbyor bas thob par bya ba yin pa ltar /
analyzed: ji ltar 'dod par gtogs pa'i sprul pa'i sems gzugs na spyod pa'i sbyor bas thob par bya ba yin pa ltar /

analyzed: 'dod pa dang gzugs na spyod pa'i ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa gzugs med pa'i sbyor bas thob par bya ba ni ma yin te /

original: de'i phyir de yang ma gtogs so//
analyzed: de'i phyir de yang ma gtogs so//
translated: Therefore it is also excluded.

original: gzugs na spyod pa'i dge ba dang zhes bya ba ni snyoms par 'jug pa'i tshe na'o //
analyzed: gzugs na spyod pa'i dge ba dang zhes bya ba ni snyoms par 'jug pa'i tshe na'o //

analyzed: de la sbyor ba las byung ba ni gang sbyor ba thob pa ste /

analyzed: de ni thos pa dang bsams pa dang bsgoms pa las byung ba'o //

analyzed: gzugs kyi khams na ni bsams pa las byung ba med de /
translated: In the realm of form, there is none arisen from reflection,

analyzed: de dag ni rgyud zhi gnas kyis brlan pa'i phyir sems kyi ting nge 'dzin nyid nye bar gnas par 'gyur ro //

analyzed: gzugs med pa'i khams na ni bsgoms pa las byung ba kho na ste gzhan med do //

original: rnam par smin pa las skyes pa dang / spyod lam pa dang / bzo'i gnas pa dang / sbrul pa'i zhes bya ba la 'di ni rgyu dang las kyi dbye bas phye ba yin no //

analyzed: de la rnam par smin pa'i rgyu las skyes pa ni rnam par smin pa las skyes pa'o //

original: spyod lam las 'byung ba ni spyod lam pa'o //
analyzed: spyod lam las 'byung ba ni spyod lam pa'o //

analyzed: de bzhin du bzo'i gnas pa dang / sprul pa las @249b byung ba ni bzo'i gnas pa dang sprul pa pa ste /
translated: Similarly, form derived from the cause of craftsmanship and form derived from the cause of emanation are form derived from the cause of craftsmanship and form derived from the cause of emanation.

original: rgyu mtshan gyi bdun par bshad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu mtshan gyi bdun par bshad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the seventh case is explained as the reason,

analyzed: yang na de dag la dmigs nas skye ba'i phyir de dag las 'byung ba'o //

analyzed: snga ma ni rgyu'i dbye bas phye ba yin no //

analyzed: rnam par smin pa las skyes pa la nges pa ma smos pas gzugs la sogs pa rnams dang / gzhan yang dmigs pa yin no zhes bya bar grub po //

original: rnam par smin pa las skyes pa ni ma gtogs te /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa las skyes pa ni ma gtogs te /

original: da ni rnam par shes pa drug car yang yin no //
analyzed: da ni rnam par shes pa drug car yang yin no //

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /

analyzed: mthong ba dang reg pa'i bar du gyur nas de dag skye ba'i phyir ro //

original: rnam par smin pa las ni sbyor ba med do //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa las ni sbyor ba med do //
translated: There is no preparation for the ripening consciousness.

analyzed: rnam par smin pa ni rang gi dang gis 'jug pa'i phyir ro // sprul pa ni sbyor ba yod mod kyi rnam pa shes pa'i tshogs lnga ni @250a * //
translated: Because the ripening consciousness operates naturally.

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: Although there is preparation for emanation, it is not the five collections of consciousness.

original: de ni bsam gtan gyi mjug thogs su 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni bsam gtan gyi mjug thogs su 'jug pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: mngon par shes pa'i 'bras bu brjod par 'dod pa'i phyir 'dis yi dags dang sha za la sogs pa la srid par thal bar mi 'gyur ro //

original: gzhan na dag na re bzo'i gnas pas mngon par bsgrubs pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gzhan na dag na re bzo'i gnas pas mngon par bsgrubs pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: Others say that it is accomplished by the state of skill in arts and crafts.

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa bzo'i gnas pas mngon par bsgrubs pa de bskyed pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa yod do zhes zer ro //
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa bzo'i gnas pas mngon par bsgrubs pa de bskyed pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa yod do zhes zer ro //

analyzed: skye mched bcu gnyis la dmigs pa zhes bya ba ni rten gyi dngos po mtha' dag la dmigs pa'i phyir ro //

original: de ni gzugs su gtogs pa'i dge ba sbyor ba las byung ba'i mjug thogs su 'byung gi /'dod pa na spyod pa'i mjug thogs su ni ma yin no //

original: gzugs na spyod pa'i sbyor ba las byung ba dang / slob pa dang mi slob pa ni snyoms par 'jug pa'i tshe na'o //
analyzed: gzugs na spyod pa'i sbyor ba las byung ba dang / slob pa dang mi slob pa ni snyoms par 'jug pa'i tshe na'o //

analyzed: dge ba sbyor ba las byung ba la gnas pa la 'chi 'pho ba mi srid pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: rang gi sa pa yin yang ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa rnams las ni ma yin te /

translated: The mind of emanation is not compatible with the mind arisen from preparation because it is incompatible with the mind arisen from preparation.

original: 'byung ba'i sems ni sbyor ba las byung ba'i sems rgyun chad pa'i sems te /
analyzed: 'byung ba'i sems ni sbyor ba las byung ba'i sems rgyun chad pa'i sems te /
translated: The mind of emanation is the mind that interrupts the continuum of the mind arisen from preparation.

original: de ni mngon par 'du bya ba med par 'jug pa yin yang rgyun chad pa dang rjes su mthun pa yin pa'i phyir sbyor ba las byung ba'i mjug thogs su 'byung bar mi 'gal lo //
analyzed: de ni mngon par 'du bya ba med par 'jug pa yin yang rgyun chad pa dang rjes su mthun pa yin pa'i phyir sbyor ba las byung ba'i mjug thogs su 'byung bar mi 'gal lo //
translated: Although it engages without exertion, it is compatible with the mind that interrupts the continuum of the mind arisen from preparation. Therefore it is not contradictory for it to arise from the mind arisen from preparation.

original: de lta na 'o na nyon mongs pa can dag las kyang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: de lta na 'o na nyon mongs pa can dag las kyang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: If that is so, then it would also arise from afflicted minds.

original: gal te sbyor ba las byung ba'i rjes su mi mthun pa'i phyir spyod lam pa la sogs pa dag las mi 'byung na /
analyzed: gal te sbyor ba las byung ba'i rjes su mi mthun pa'i phyir spyod lam pa la sogs pa dag las mi 'byung na /
translated: If it is not compatible with the mind arisen from preparation, then it would not arise from the minds of emanation, because it is not compatible with the mind arisen from preparation.

original: de lta na 'o na ni yul mngon par 'dod pa lhur len pa nyid kyis mi mthun pa'i phyir dang / stobs chung ba'i phyir nyon mongs pa can dag las kyang sbyor ba las byung ba 'byung bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta na 'o na ni yul mngon par 'dod pa lhur len pa nyid kyis mi mthun pa'i phyir dang / stobs chung ba'i phyir nyon mongs pa can dag las kyang sbyor ba las byung ba 'byung bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: If that is so, then even from afflicted states, access concentration would not arise, because it is incompatible with them, since it is intent on the object that is its antidote, and because it is weak.

original: nyon mongs pa can gyi chos ni dge ba'i chos kyi rjes su mthun par mi rung ngo //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can gyi chos ni dge ba'i chos kyi rjes su mthun par mi rung ngo //
translated: For it is not possible for an afflicted phenomenon to be compatible with a virtuous phenomenon.

original: 'on kyang zhes bya ba ni de'i rjes su mi mthun pa yin mod kyi zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang zhes bya ba ni de'i rjes su mi mthun pa yin mod kyi zhes bya ba'o //
translated: However, even though it is incompatible with them,

original: nyon mongs pa kun du 'byung bas zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa kun du 'byung bas zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la //
translated: it is compatible with the arising of access concentration, because it is compatible with the arising of the knowledge that fully understands the arising of affliction.

original: nyon mongs pa kun du 'byung bar yongs su shes pa nyid chos la nges par sems pa'i bzod pa la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa yin la /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa kun du 'byung bar yongs su shes pa nyid chos la nges par sems pa'i bzod pa la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa yin la /
translated: The knowledge that fully understands the arising of affliction is the discernment of the patience that is the discernment of phenomena and so on.

original: de yang sbyor ba las byung ba yin pas nyon mongs pa can gyi mjug thogs su 'byung bar rigs so //
analyzed: de yang sbyor ba las byung ba yin pas nyon mongs pa can gyi mjug thogs su 'byung bar rigs so //
translated: And since that is access concentration, it is logical that it arises after afflicted states.

original: nyon mongs pa can ni stobs chung ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can ni stobs chung ba yang ma yin te /
translated: And afflicted states are not weak.

original: thog ma med pa'i dus nas goms pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thog ma med pa'i dus nas goms pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is cultivated from beginningless time.

original: de'i phyir de nyon mongs pa can gyi mjug thogs su 'byung bar mi 'gal lo //
analyzed: de'i phyir de nyon mongs pa can gyi mjug thogs su 'byung bar mi 'gal lo //
translated: Therefore, it is not contradictory for it to arise immediately after a defiled thought.

original: mngon par 'du bya ba med par 'byung ba'i phyir zhes bya ba 'byung ngo //
analyzed: mngon par 'du bya ba med par 'byung ba'i phyir zhes bya ba 'byung ngo //
translated: It arises without application.

original: ji ltar mngon par 'du bya ba med par 'byung zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar mngon par 'du bya ba med par 'byung zhe na /
translated: How does it arise without application?

original: sbyor ba la mi ltos ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sbyor ba la mi ltos ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it does not depend on preparatory effort.

original: 'o na ji ltar de gsal ba nyid yin zhe na las su rung ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar de gsal ba nyid yin zhe na las su rung ba'i phyir te /
translated: How then is it clear? Because it is serviceable.

analyzed: de ni dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad kyi sa bon yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the seed of all wholesome roots.

original: gsal ba'i phyir skyabs byed par nus pas gzugs na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa can gyi mjug thogs su ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'i skyes nas thob pa 'byung ngo //

original: 'di ni mjug thogs su ni 'di'o //
analyzed: 'di ni mjug thogs su ni 'di'o //

analyzed: sa gsum ni mi lcogs pa med pa dang / bsam gtan dang bo dang bsam gtan khyad par can no //
translated: The three stages are the stage of unrestricted access to the first meditative absorption, the special stage of meditative absorption and the first meditative absorption.

translated: Since the stage of the first concentration and the special stage of the first concentration are obstructed by the stage of unrestricted access concentration, how can one manifest the first concentration?

analyzed: gal te bsam gtan gnyis pa la sogs pa'i sa pa kho na mngon du byed par 'gyur bas nyes pa 'di med do zhe na /
translated: If you say that this error does not exist because one manifests only the second concentration and so on,üîΩthen why does the Abhidharmakosa say, One who manifests the first concentration does not obtain the first concentration of the lower level?

original: de stobs chung ba nyid ni sems kyi rgyud gzugs kyi 'du shes dang ma bral ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: de stobs chung ba nyid ni sems kyi rgyud gzugs kyi 'du shes dang ma bral ba'i phyir te /
translated: Its weakness is due to the fact that the mental continuum is not free from the perception of form.

original: stobs chung ba ni rten stobs dang ldan pa la ma ltos par 'byung bar mi nus so //
analyzed: stobs chung ba ni rten stobs dang ldan pa la ma ltos par 'byung bar mi nus so //
translated: That which is weak cannot occur without relying on a powerful support.

original: de'i phyir de ni gzugs la brten nas 'jug go //
analyzed: de'i phyir de ni gzugs la brten nas 'jug go //
translated: Therefore, it operates in dependence on form.

original: des na ris dang srog kyang brten nas 'jug ste /
analyzed: des na ris dang srog kyang brten nas 'jug ste /
translated: Thus, the class and life force also operate in dependence on form,

original: de nyid kyang stobs chung ba'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: de nyid kyang stobs chung ba'i phyir ro ;
translated: because they are also weak.

original: / des na ci'i phyir stobs dang ldan pa nyid yin zhes bya ba ni gzugs med pa'i sems kyi rgyud de ste /
analyzed: / des na ci'i phyir stobs dang ldan pa nyid yin zhes bya ba ni gzugs med pa'i sems kyi rgyud de ste /
translated: Why is the mental continuum of the formless realm powerful?

original: de'i phyir snyoms par 'jug pa'i khyad par las skyes pa'i phyir te zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir snyoms par 'jug pa'i khyad par las skyes pa'i phyir te zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Therefore, he says, because it arises from the special meditative attainment.

original: snyoms par 'jug pa de snyoms par 'jug pa gzhan las khyad par du 'phags pa bstan pa'i phyir snyoms par 'jug pa de ni gzugs dang bral ba'i 'du shes can yin no zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug pa de snyoms par 'jug pa gzhan las khyad par du 'phags pa bstan pa'i phyir snyoms par 'jug pa de ni gzugs dang bral ba'i 'du shes can yin no zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: In order to demonstrate that meditative attainment is superior to other meditative attainments, he says, that meditative attainment has the perception of being free from form.

original: gzugs kyi 'du shes dang bral ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gzugs kyi 'du shes dang bral ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the phrase free from the discernment of form is that.

original: de'i phyir de na gzugs la mi ltos par ris dang srog la brten nas 'jug ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir de na gzugs la mi ltos par ris dang srog la brten nas 'jug ste /
translated: Therefore, it operates in dependence on the class and life force, without relying on form.

original: dper na 'dod chags dang bral ba'i phyir gzugs kyi khams na kham gyi zas med par lus gnas la /
analyzed: dper na 'dod chags dang bral ba'i phyir gzugs kyi khams na kham gyi zas med par lus gnas la /
translated: For example, in the form realm, the body is sustained without oral food, because one is free from attachment to it.

original: de'i 'dod chags ma bral ba'i phyir 'dod pa'i khams na ni ma yin pa bzhin no //
analyzed: de'i 'dod chags ma bral ba'i phyir 'dod pa'i khams na ni ma yin pa bzhin no //
translated: But in the desire realm, it is not, because one is not free from attachment to it.

original: 'o na ni stobs dang ldan bas te snyoms par 'jug pa'i khyad par gyis skyed pa de kho nas ris dang srog la ltos pa med par 'jug par 'gyur gyi rten gzhan gyis ci zhig bya /üîΩ@260b ji ltar gzugs can rnams kyis zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: 'o na ni stobs dang ldan bas te snyoms par 'jug pa'i khyad par gyis skyed pa de kho nas ris dang srog la ltos pa med par 'jug par 'gyur gyi rten gzhan gyis ci zhig bya / @260b ji ltar gzugs can rnams kyis zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: If that is so, then it is generated by the power of meditative equipoise and it operates without relying on the class and life force, so what is the purpose of another basis?üîΩHow do those possessing form?

original: ji ltar gzugs rnams kyi ris mthun pa dang srog gi dbang po gzugs la brten nas yin pa de ltar gzugs can ma yin pa rnams kyi de dag ci la brten nas yin /
analyzed: ji ltar gzugs rnams kyi ris mthun pa dang srog gi dbang po gzugs la brten nas yin pa de ltar gzugs can ma yin pa rnams kyi de dag ci la brten nas yin /
translated: How do those possessing form rely on the class and life force?

original: de gnyis nyid phan tshun du'o zhes bya ba la /üîΩris mthun pa ni srog gi dbang po la brten nas 'jug la /
analyzed: de gnyis nyid phan tshun du'o zhes bya ba la / ris mthun pa ni srog gi dbang po la brten nas 'jug la /
translated: The two are mutually dependent.

original: srog gi dbang po yang ris mthun pa la brten nas so //
analyzed: srog gi dbang po yang ris mthun pa la brten nas so //
translated: The homogeneous character is maintained by the life faculty, and the life faculty is maintained by the homogeneous character.

original: de gnyis zhes bya ba ni ris mthun pa dang srog gi dbang po gnyis so //
analyzed: de gnyis zhes bya ba ni ris mthun pa dang srog gi dbang po gnyis so //
translated: The two are the homogeneous character and the life faculty.

original: stobs chung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni de dag gi rgyu gzugs kyi 'du shes dang ma bral ba'i phyir stobs chung ba nyid do //
analyzed: stobs chung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni de dag gi rgyu gzugs kyi 'du shes dang ma bral ba'i phyir stobs chung ba nyid do //
translated: Because they are weak, because they are not free from the ideation of form, which is their cause.

original: de na zhes bya ba ni gzugs med pa'i khams na'o //
analyzed: de na zhes bya ba ni gzugs med pa'i khams na'o //
translated: There means in the formless realm.

original: snyoms par 'jug pa'i khyad par las skyes pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni de'i rgyu gzugs kyi 'du shes dang bral ba yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug pa'i khyad par las skyes pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni de'i rgyu gzugs kyi 'du shes dang bral ba yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Because they arise from the special meditative attainment, because they are free from the ideation of form, which is their cause.

original: de ni sems kyi rgyud la yang mtshungs so //
analyzed: de ni sems kyi rgyud la yang mtshungs so //
translated: This is also the case for the mental continuum.

original: de gang zhe na /
analyzed: de gang zhe na /
translated: What is that?

original: ting nge 'dzin gyi khyad par las skyes pa'i phyir stobs dang ldan pa nyid de /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi khyad par las skyes pa'i phyir stobs dang ldan pa nyid de /
translated: Because it arises from the special meditative attainment, it is strong.

original: de'i phyir rten med pa kho nar 'jug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir rten med pa kho nar 'jug par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, it would engage its object without depending on anything.

original: yang na skad cig ma dang po la brten nas gnyis pa 'jug pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: yang na skad cig ma dang po la brten nas gnyis pa 'jug pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Or, it would engage its object in dependence on the first moment of consciousness, and so on.

original: sems dang sems las byung ba dag la yang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba dag la yang zhes bya ba la /
translated: And also for minds and mental factors.

original: gal te mi brten pa'am 'gag pa la brten par mi 'dod na /
analyzed: gal te mi brten pa'am 'gag pa la brten par mi 'dod na /
translated: If you do not assert that they engage their objects without depending on something or in dependence on cessation,

original: 'o na ni de dang ris mthun pa dang srog gi dbang po gnyis phan tshun bsten nas 'jug pa de bzhin du sems la brten nas sems las byung ba rnams sam /
analyzed: 'o na ni de dang ris mthun pa dang srog gi dbang po gnyis phan tshun bsten nas 'jug pa de bzhin du sems la brten nas sems las byung ba rnams sam /
translated: then just as the two, the life faculty and the homogeneous collection of parts, engage their objects in dependence on each other, so too the mental factors engage their objects in dependence on the mind, or the mind engages its object in dependence on the mental factors.

original: sems las byung ba rnams la brten nas sems 'jug pas de las gzhan pa'i rten yongs su rtog pa dgos pa med do //üîΩgzhan yang sems kyi rgyun gang gis zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: sems las byung ba rnams la brten nas sems 'jug pas de las gzhan pa'i rten yongs su rtog pa dgos pa med do // gzhan yang sems kyi rgyun gang gis zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: Therefore, there is no need to imagine any other basis for their engagement.

original: sems kyi rgyun gyi 'phen pa'i rgyu ni las dang nyon mongs pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: sems kyi rgyun gyi 'phen pa'i rgyu ni las dang nyon mongs pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: Moreover, the mind stream that is propelled by karma and afflicted states is the cause that propels the mind stream.

original: sred pa dang bral ba zhes bya ba ni sred pa dang mi ldan zhing bral ba'o //
analyzed: sred pa dang bral ba zhes bya ba ni sred pa dang mi ldan zhing bral ba'o //
translated: The phrase free from craving means not possessing craving and being separated from craving.

original: gang zhe na gzugs la ste /
analyzed: gang zhe na gzugs la ste /
translated: What is it? It is form.

original: sems kyi rgyud de ni gzugs la mi ltos par 'jug go //
analyzed: sems kyi rgyud de ni gzugs la mi ltos par 'jug go //
translated: That mental continuum operates without depending on form.

original: rgyu de la rgyab kyis phyogs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni gzugs la rgyab kyis phyogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu de la rgyab kyis phyogs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni gzugs la rgyab kyis phyogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it turns its back on that cause, means because it turns its back on form.

original: 'dod pa dang ldan pa'i khams ni 'dod pa'i khams so zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'dod pa dang ldan pa'i khams ni 'dod pa'i khams so zhes bya ba la /
translated: The realm that possesses desire is the desire realm.

original: gnas nyi shu ni 'dod pa'i gtso bo yin pa'i phyir 'dod pa'i sgras brjod do //
analyzed: gnas nyi shu ni 'dod pa'i gtso bo yin pa'i phyir 'dod pa'i sgras brjod do //
translated: The twenty abodes are called the desire realm because they are the principal desires.

original: de dang ldan pa ni de dang bral ba ma yin pa ste /üîΩde'i @261a * //
analyzed: de dang ldan pa ni de dang bral ba ma yin pa ste / de'i @261a * //
translated: Possessing that is not being separated from that.üîΩIt is included in that.

original: khongs su 'du zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: khongs su 'du zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning.

original: gnas bcu bdun ni gzugs gtso bo yin pa'i phyir gzugs kyi sgras bsnyad de /
analyzed: gnas bcu bdun ni gzugs gtso bo yin pa'i phyir gzugs kyi sgras bsnyad de /
translated: The seventeen abodes are called the form realm because they are the principal forms.

original: de dang ldan pa'i khams ni gzugs kyi khams so //
analyzed: de dang ldan pa'i khams ni gzugs kyi khams so //
translated: The realm that possesses that is the form realm.

original: rdo rje'i sor gdub lta bu dang // zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rdo rje'i sor gdub lta bu dang // zhes bya ba la /
translated: Like a diamond ring.

original: rdo rje dang ldan pa'i sor gdub ste 'gu ya'am gdu bu ni rdo rje'i gdu bu yin pa bzhin no //
analyzed: rdo rje dang ldan pa'i sor gdub ste 'gu ya'am gdu bu ni rdo rje'i gdu bu yin pa bzhin no //
translated: The ring of the vajra is the vajra ring.

original: na le sham gyi btung ba zhes bya ba bzhin no zhes bya ba la /üîΩji ltar bar gyi tshig mi mngon par byas pa'i phyir na le sham dang ldan pa'i btung ba ni na le sham gyi btung ba yin pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: na le sham gyi btung ba zhes bya ba bzhin no zhes bya ba la / ji ltar bar gyi tshig mi mngon par byas pa'i phyir na le sham dang ldan pa'i btung ba ni na le sham gyi btung ba yin pa de bzhin du /
translated: Like the drink of liquorice,

original: 'dod pa dang ldan pa'i khams kyang 'dod pa'i khams la sogs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dod pa dang ldan pa'i khams kyang 'dod pa'i khams la sogs pa yin no //
translated: Just as the drink of liquorice is the drink that has liquorice, so too the realm that has desire is the desire realm.

original: gzugs med pa'i khams na gnas med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i khams na gnas med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no place in the formless realm.

original: gzugs med pa'i do bo ni gzugs med pa nyid do zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i do bo ni gzugs med pa nyid do zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The formless realm is the formlessness itself.

original: de ni thogs pa med pa nyid do //
analyzed: de ni thogs pa med pa nyid do //
translated: That is the very absence of obstruction.

original: de dang ldan pa'i khams ni zhes bya ba ni thogs pa med pa'i bdag nyid can no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de dang ldan pa'i khams ni zhes bya ba ni thogs pa med pa'i bdag nyid can no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The realm that has that is the realm that has the nature of absence of obstruction.

original: yang na 'dod pa rnams kyi khams ni zhes bya ba 'byung ngo //
analyzed: yang na 'dod pa rnams kyi khams ni zhes bya ba 'byung ngo //
translated: Or else, the realm of the desires is the realm of the desires.

original: 'dod pa rnams kyi khams de yang gang zhig ce na /
analyzed: 'dod pa rnams kyi khams de yang gang zhig ce na /
translated: What is that realm of desire?

original: gang zhig 'dod pa rnams 'dzin pa'o zhes bya ba smos te srel zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gang zhig 'dod pa rnams 'dzin pa'o zhes bya ba smos te srel zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It is that which grasps the objects of desire.

original: gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams dag kyang de dang 'dra bar rig par bya'o zhes bya ba la ;üîΩgzugs rnams kyi khams ni gzugs kyi khams te /
analyzed: gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams dag kyang de dang 'dra bar rig par bya'o zhes bya ba la ; gzugs rnams kyi khams ni gzugs kyi khams te /
translated: The realms of form and the formless should be understood in the same way.

original: gang zhig gzugs rnams 'dzin pa'o //üîΩde bzhin du gzugs med pa rnams kyi khams ni gzugs med pa'i khams te /
analyzed: gang zhig gzugs rnams 'dzin pa'o // de bzhin du gzugs med pa rnams kyi khams ni gzugs med pa'i khams te /
translated: The realm of form is that which grasps the forms.

original: gang zhig gzugs med pa rnams 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: gang zhig gzugs med pa rnams 'dzin pa'o //
translated: The realm of the formless is that which grasps the formless.üîΩThe realm of desire is that which grasps the objects of desire.

original: 'dod pa rnams kyi khams ni zhes bya ba smos pa de'i phyir 'dod pa zhes bya ba 'di ci yin zhe na zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: 'dod pa rnams kyi khams ni zhes bya ba smos pa de'i phyir 'dod pa zhes bya ba 'di ci yin zhe na zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Therefore, what are the objects of desire?

original: kham gyi zas dang 'khrig pa dang ldan pa'i zhes bya ba ni de'i rgyu mtshan can dang / de'i yul can zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: kham gyi zas dang 'khrig pa dang ldan pa'i zhes bya ba ni de'i rgyu mtshan can dang / de'i yul can zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It is that which is associated with oral food and sexual intercourse. It is that which has those as its causal basis and those as its object.

original: ji skad bshad pa'i 'dod chags 'dod pa yin no zhes bya bar ji ltar shes par bya zhe na /
analyzed: ji skad bshad pa'i 'dod chags 'dod pa yin no zhes bya bar ji ltar shes par bya zhe na /
translated: How do you know that the attachment explained above is desire?

original: 'jig rten sna tshogs gang de 'dod pa min zhe na rgya cher 'byung ba'i lung las so //
analyzed: 'jig rten sna tshogs gang de 'dod pa min zhe na rgya cher 'byung ba'i lung las so //
translated: Because it is said in the extensive passage, ‚ÄúIf the various things of the world are not desire, what is?‚Äù

original: kun du rtog pas skyed pa'i 'dod chags ni kun rtog 'dod chags te /
analyzed: kun du rtog pas skyed pa'i 'dod chags ni kun rtog 'dod chags te /
translated: Attachment generated by imagination is the attachment of imagination.

original: de ni tshul bzhin ma yin pa'i rtog pa sngon du 'gro ba can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni tshul bzhin ma yin pa'i rtog pa sngon du 'gro ba can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is preceded by incorrect imagination.

original: de'i phyir tshigs su bcad pa 'di las ni kun du rtog pa'i 'dod chags @261b kho na 'dod pa yin no zhes bya bar shes so //
analyzed: de'i phyir tshigs su bcad pa 'di las ni kun du rtog pa'i 'dod chags @261b kho na 'dod pa yin no zhes bya bar shes so //
translated: Therefore, in this verse, it is known that only the attachment of imagination is desire.

original: de ni mi dge'i rtog pa kun rtog tshe //
analyzed: de ni mi dge'i rtog pa kun rtog tshe //
translated: When there is the imagination of nonvirtue,

original: dge slong yang ni 'dod spyod can du 'gyur //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: dge slong yang ni 'dod spyod can du 'gyur // zhes bya ba la /
translated: even a monk is one who indulges in desire.

original: mngon du gyur pa tsam zhig de dag gis nye bar longs spyod pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon du gyur pa tsam zhig de dag gis nye bar longs spyod pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they enjoy it merely as something manifest.

original: 'dod pa nye bar longs spyod pa ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: 'dod pa nye bar longs spyod pa ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: Indulging in desire is of three kinds:

original: lus dang ngag dang yid kyis so //
analyzed: lus dang ngag dang yid kyis so //
translated: by body, speech, and mind.

original: 'phags pa sh'a ri'i bus zhes bya ba ni gong du smras pa khyad du bsad nas skyon gzhan smras pa'o //üîΩgal te 'jig rten zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: 'phags pa sh'a ri'i bus zhes bya ba ni gong du smras pa khyad du bsad nas skyon gzhan smras pa'o // gal te 'jig rten zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: The phrase the noble son Shariputra refers to someone who, having disregarded what was said above, speaks of another fault.

original: gal te gzugs la sogs pa yul sna tshogs pa dag yin no zhes bya ba khyod kyi phyogs yin zhing /
analyzed: gal te gzugs la sogs pa yul sna tshogs pa dag yin no zhes bya ba khyod kyi phyogs yin zhing /
translated: If the world is... means that if the position is that the various objects such as form, etc., are the world,

original: ston pa yang khyod kyis 'dod chags dang bral bar khas blangs na /
analyzed: ston pa yang khyod kyis 'dod chags dang bral bar khas blangs na /
translated: and if you accept that the Teacher is free from attachment,

original: des na khyod kyi ston pa 'od 'dod spyod can du 'ong ste 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na khyod kyi ston pa 'od 'dod spyod can du 'ong ste 'gyur ro //
translated: then your Teacher would be one who enjoys the objects of desire.

original: gzugs rnams mthong nas ni zhes bya ba ni dpe tsam zhig ste /
analyzed: gzugs rnams mthong nas ni zhes bya ba ni dpe tsam zhig ste /
translated: The phrase having seen forms is merely an example.

original: reg rnams reg na ni zhes bya ba'i bar du yang de bzhin du khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: reg rnams reg na ni zhes bya ba'i bar du yang de bzhin du khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: The phrase having touched tangibles should be understood in the same way.

original: 'di ltar mthong ba dang thos pa dang / bsnams pa dad myangs pa dang / reg pa rnams ni yul gyi 'dod pa rnams nye bar longs spyod pa yin pas khyod kyi ston pa 'dod chags sra dang bral ba yang gzugs kyi reg pa la sogs pa la 'dod pa nye bar longs spyod pa can nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar mthong ba dang thos pa dang / bsnams pa dad myangs pa dang / reg pa rnams ni yul gyi 'dod pa rnams nye bar longs spyod pa yin pas khyod kyi ston pa 'dod chags sra dang bral ba yang gzugs kyi reg pa la sogs pa la 'dod pa nye bar longs spyod pa can nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, seeing, hearing, smelling, tasting, touching, and enjoying objects are the enjoyment of objects. Therefore, even your teacher, who is free from attachment, would be one who enjoys objects such as the contact of form.

original: kho bo'i ltar na ni dag slong 'dod chags dang ma bral ba kho na 'dod pa spyod pa can du 'gyur gyi 'dod chags dang bral ba ni ma yin la /
analyzed: kho bo'i ltar na ni dag slong 'dod chags dang ma bral ba kho na 'dod pa spyod pa can du 'gyur gyi 'dod chags dang bral ba ni ma yin la /
translated: According to us, only a lustful mendicant who is not free from attachment would enjoy objects, not one free from attachment.

original: de yang yid kyi sgo nas 'gyur gyi lus dang dag gi sgo nas ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de yang yid kyi sgo nas 'gyur gyi lus dang dag gi sgo nas ni ma yin no //
translated: Moreover, that is done mentally, not physically or verbally.

original: 'di tsam gyis ni dge slong dge slong ma yin par 'gyur ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di tsam gyis ni dge slong dge slong ma yin par 'gyur ba yang ma yin te /
translated: One does not become a monk or a nun merely by this.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What then?

original: pham par 'gyur ba'i ltung ba dang 'brel pa las yin la /
analyzed: pham par 'gyur ba'i ltung ba dang 'brel pa las yin la /
translated: One becomes a monk or a nun by being connected to the downfalls that are defeats.

original: de yang lus kho na'i sgo nas yin no //
analyzed: de yang lus kho na'i sgo nas yin no //
translated: Moreover, that is done physically.

original: de'i phyir skyes bu'i kun du rtog pa'i 'dod chags 'dod pa yin no zhes bya bar grub po //
analyzed: de'i phyir skyes bu'i kun du rtog pa'i 'dod chags 'dod pa yin no zhes bya bar grub po //
translated: Therefore, it is established that desire is the conception of a person‚Äôs desire.

original: yang ci chos gang dag ces bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: yang ci chos gang dag ces bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: Again, which dharmas are possessed by which sentient beings?

original: gang dag ces bya ba ni kha cig dag ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gang dag ces bya ba ni kha cig dag ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: Which means some.

original: 'dod pa'i khams na ni snyoms par 'jug pa'i cho ;
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams na ni snyoms par 'jug pa'i cho ;
translated: In the desire realm, one possesses the dharmas of meditative attainment.

original: gzugs dang gzugs med pa dang zag pa med pa rnams kun du spyod la /
analyzed: gzugs dang gzugs med pa dang zag pa med pa rnams kun du spyod la /
translated: One possesses the formless and uncontaminated dharmas.

original: gzhan gyi tshe ni thob pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi tshe ni thob pa'o //
translated: One possesses them at other times through obtainment.

translated: The five reincarnating beings are subsumed by the four birth processes.

original: skye gnas rnams sems can zhes pa kho na yin pa'i phyir 'gro ba rnams kyang sems can zhes bya ba kho na yin no zhes shes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skye gnas rnams sems can zhes pa kho na yin pa'i phyir 'gro ba rnams kyang sems can zhes bya ba kho na yin no zhes shes par 'gyur ro //
translated: Because the modes of birth are only sentient beings, it is understood that the destinies are also only sentient beings.

original: 'gro ba rnams sems can zhes bya ba ma yin pa nyid yin na ni skye gnas dag tu 'du bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'gro ba rnams sems can zhes bya ba ma yin pa nyid yin na ni skye gnas dag tu 'du bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: If the destinies were not sentient beings, they would not be included in the modes of birth,

original: dper na 'gro ba rnams su skye gnas dag mi 'du ba dag bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na 'gro ba rnams su skye gnas dag mi 'du ba dag bzhin no //
translated: just as the modes of birth are not included in the destinies.

original: 'gro ba lngas ni skye gnas bzhi zhes bya ba la ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'gro ba lngas ni skye gnas bzhi zhes bya ba la ci zhe na /
translated: What is the meaning of the statement, ‚ÄúThe five destinies are the four modes of birth‚Äù?

original: ma bsdus te skabs dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: ma bsdus te skabs dang sbyar ro //
translated: It is not included, as the context shows.

original: ci zhig ma bsdus she na /
analyzed: ci zhig ma bsdus she na /
translated: What is not included?

original: srid pa bar ma'o zhes 'byung ba las na /
analyzed: srid pa bar ma'o zhes 'byung ba las na /
translated: The intermediate existence, because it is said, ‚ÄúThe intermediate existence is not included.‚Äù

original: de bsdus te skye ba'i skye gnas kyis bsdus kyang /
analyzed: de bsdus te skye ba'i skye gnas kyis bsdus kyang /
translated: Although it is included in birth,

original: 'gro ba rnams su ma 'dus pa'i phyir 'gro ba srid pa bar ma ma yin no zhes bya bar shes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'gro ba rnams su ma 'dus pa'i phyir 'gro ba srid pa bar ma ma yin no zhes bya bar shes par 'gyur ro //
translated: it is understood that the intermediate existence is not a destiny because it is not included in the destinies.

original: de lta ma yin na skye ba'i srid pa la sogs pa dang 'dra bar de yang 'gro bas bsdus par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na skye ba'i srid pa la sogs pa dang 'dra bar de yang 'gro bas bsdus par 'gyur ro //
translated: If that were not so, then like the birth existence and so on, it would be subsumed by the reincarnating beings.

original: de'i phyir srid pa bar ma 'gro ba'i rang bzhin ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir srid pa bar ma 'gro ba'i rang bzhin ma yin no //
translated: Therefore the intermediate existence is not by nature a reincarnating being.

original: yang 'gro ba srid pa bar ma ma yin no zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: yang 'gro ba srid pa bar ma ma yin no zhes bya ba la /
translated: Also, the reincarnating beings are not intermediate existence.üîΩThe second treatise states:

original: bstan bcos gnyis pa dper brjod pa ni chos kyi phung po las kyang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ste /üîΩ'di las ni bsgoms pa las byung ba ltar srid pa bar ma pa yang dmyal ba la sogs pa'i mig gi dbang po las tha dad pang logs shig tu bstan te /
analyzed: bstan bcos gnyis pa dper brjod pa ni chos kyi phung po las kyang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ste / 'di las ni bsgoms pa las byung ba ltar srid pa bar ma pa yang dmyal ba la sogs pa'i mig gi dbang po las tha dad pang logs shig tu bstan te /
translated: The Abhidharmako≈õa declares:üîΩThis text teaches that the intermediate existence is separate from the eye faculty of hell beings and so on, like that derived from meditation.

original: de'i phyir de yang bsgoms pa las byung ba ltar dmyal ba la sogs pa'i 'gro bas bsdus pa ma yin pas srid pa bar ma 'gro ba'i rang bzhin ma yin no zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir de yang bsgoms pa las byung ba ltar dmyal ba la sogs pa'i 'gro bas bsdus pa ma yin pas srid pa bar ma 'gro ba'i rang bzhin ma yin no zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore it teaches that the intermediate existence is not subsumed by the reincarnating beings of hell and so on, like that derived from meditation.

original: gzhan du na ni dmyal ba la sogs pa'i mig gis srid pa bar ma pa yang bstan pas yang ci'i phyir brjod /üîΩbstan bcos las srid pa @264a * //
analyzed: gzhan du na ni dmyal ba la sogs pa'i mig gis srid pa bar ma pa yang bstan pas yang ci'i phyir brjod / bstan bcos las srid pa @264a * //
translated: Otherwise, since the intermediate existence would be seen by the eyes of hell beings and so on, why would it be said that they do not see it?

original: bar ma 'gro ba rnams las logs shig tu mdzad pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad de 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: bar ma 'gro ba rnams las logs shig tu mdzad pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad de 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: Not only is the intermediate existence not mentioned separately from the reincarnating beings in the treatise,

original: mdo las kyang srid pa bar ma 'gro ba rnams las logs shig tu mdzad do zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: mdo las kyang srid pa bar ma 'gro ba rnams las logs shig tu mdzad do zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: but also in the sutra it is not mentioned separately from the reincarnating beings.

original: srid pa bar ma 'gro ba'i rang bzhin ma yin pa dang / 'gro ba rnams lung du ma bstan pa nyid kyi khungs ni las kyi srid pa dang / srid pa bar ma'o zhes dmyal ba la sogs pa dag las logs shig tu smos pa 'dis yin no //
analyzed: srid pa bar ma 'gro ba'i rang bzhin ma yin pa dang / 'gro ba rnams lung du ma bstan pa nyid kyi khungs ni las kyi srid pa dang / srid pa bar ma'o zhes dmyal ba la sogs pa dag las logs shig tu smos pa 'dis yin no //
translated: The source for the statement that the intermediate existence is not a reincarnating being and that the reincarnating beings are neutral is the statement in the sutra that the intermediate existence is separate from the reincarnating beings such as hell beings and so on.

original: rgyu dang bcas pa dang 'gro ba dang bcas par bshad do zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rgyu dang bcas pa dang 'gro ba dang bcas par bshad do zhes bya ba la /
translated: The sutra explains that the reincarnating beings have a cause and they have a destination.

original: 'gro ba rnams kyi rgyu ni las kyi srid pa yin la /
analyzed: 'gro ba rnams kyi rgyu ni las kyi srid pa yin la /
translated: The cause of the reincarnating beings is the existence of karma.

original: 'gro ba ni srid pa bar ma yin te /
analyzed: 'gro ba ni srid pa bar ma yin te /
translated: The destination of the reincarnating beings is the intermediate existence.

original: 'dis 'gro bar byed pas na zhes byas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dis 'gro bar byed pas na zhes byas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is said that it causes going.

original: de nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba ni mdo'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba ni mdo'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúFor that very reason‚Äù means for the reason of the sutra.

original: de'i rgyu zhes bya ba ni 'gro ba'i rgyu las kyi srid pa ste /
analyzed: de'i rgyu zhes bya ba ni 'gro ba'i rgyu las kyi srid pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúIts cause‚Äù is the cause of going, which is karmic existence.

original: 'gro ba dag las logs shig tu mdzad pa'i phyir 'gro ba rnams ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa nyid du grub pa yin no //
analyzed: 'gro ba dag las logs shig tu mdzad pa'i phyir 'gro ba rnams ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa nyid du grub pa yin no //
translated: Since it is made separate from the destinies, it is established that the destinies are unobscured-neutral.

original: kha che ba rnams kyang zhes bya ba la /üîΩmdo de ni lung bzhir ma 'dus pa'i phyir kha yar ba zhig de dag gis ston to //
analyzed: kha che ba rnams kyang zhes bya ba la / mdo de ni lung bzhir ma 'dus pa'i phyir kha yar ba zhig de dag gis ston to //
translated: Also the Kasmiri Vaibhasikas.üîΩThey teach that sutra because it is not included in the four collections of scriptures.

original: dmyal ba'i zag pa rnams zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /üîΩlus dang ngag dang yid kyi skyon ni g-yos kun nas bslangs pa dag go //üîΩlus dang ngag dang yid kyi skyon ni zhe sdang gis kun nas bslangs pa dag go ;
analyzed: dmyal ba'i zag pa rnams zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la / lus dang ngag dang yid kyi skyon ni g-yos kun nas bslangs pa dag go // lus dang ngag dang yid kyi skyon ni zhe sdang gis kun nas bslangs pa dag go ;
translated: The sutra says:üîΩThe faults of body, speech, and mind are motivated by envy.üîΩThe faults of body, speech, and mind are motivated by aversion.

original: / lus dang ngag dang yid kyi snyigs ma ni 'dod chags kyis kun nas bslangs pa dag go //
analyzed: / lus dang ngag dang yid kyi snyigs ma ni 'dod chags kyis kun nas bslangs pa dag go //
translated: The dregs of body, speech, and mind are motivated by attachment.

original: rnam par smin pa grub nas dmyal ba zhes bya ba'i grangs su 'gro'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa grub nas dmyal ba zhes bya ba'i grangs su 'gro'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: and when the karmic maturation is established, it is counted as a hell being.üîΩThe realms of sentient beings are unobscured-non-defined.

original: 'gro ba rnams ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa yin no zhes bya ba 'di la khungs ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: 'gro ba rnams ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa yin no zhes bya ba 'di la khungs ni 'di yin te /
translated: This is the source of that statement.

original: rnam par smin pa ni ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa'i phyir rnam par smin pa'i gnas skabs na dmyal bar 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa ni ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa'i phyir rnam par smin pa'i gnas skabs na dmyal bar 'gyur gyi /
translated: Because karmic maturation is unobscured-non-defined, it is a hell being when it is the state of karmic maturation.

original: de myong bar 'gyur ba'i las dang nyon mongs pa'i gnas skabs su ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de myong bar 'gyur ba'i las dang nyon mongs pa'i gnas skabs su ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: But it is not the state of karma and affliction that is to be experienced.

original: tshe dang ldan pa de la chos de dag ma gtogs pa dmyal ba mi dmigs so zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa de la chos de dag ma gtogs pa dmyal ba mi dmigs so zhes bya ba la /
translated: The Venerable One does not observe a hell being apart from those phenomena.

original: dmyal ba dag tu gzugs la sogs pa gang dag rnam par smin pa'i bdag nyid du grub pa de dag kho na dmyal ba yin gyi /
analyzed: dmyal ba dag tu gzugs la sogs pa gang dag rnam par smin pa'i bdag nyid du grub pa de dag kho na dmyal ba yin gyi /
translated: The forms, etc. that are established as the nature of karmic maturation in the hells are the very hells.

original: de dag las gzhan pa'i dmyal ba dge ba'am mi dge ba'i chos ni mi dmigs so //
analyzed: de dag las gzhan pa'i dmyal ba dge ba'am mi dge ba'i chos ni mi dmigs so //
translated: Apart from those, a virtuous or nonvirtuous phenomenon called a hell being is not observed.

original: de nyid kyi phyir sems can zhes bya ba yang grub ste /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir sems can zhes bya ba yang grub ste /
translated: Therefore, the term ‚Äúsentient being‚Äù is also established,

original: rnam par smin pa ni sems can du brjod pa @264b yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa ni sems can du brjod pa @264b yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the state of evolution is called ‚Äúsentient being.‚Äù

original: dmyal ba'i 'gro ba ni 'dir dper brjod pa tsam zhig tu zad do //
analyzed: dmyal ba'i 'gro ba ni 'dir dper brjod pa tsam zhig tu zad do //
translated: The destiny of hell is merely an example here.üîΩNow, in the treatise topic divisions,

original: 'o na rab tu byed pa'i gzhung zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'o na rab tu byed pa'i gzhung zhes bya ba la /
translated: it says,

original: 'dir ci la lan gdab par bya /
analyzed: 'dir ci la lan gdab par bya /
translated: ‚ÄúWhat is the answer here?

original: 'gro ba rnams ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa yin pa'i phyir bsgom pas spang par bya ba nyid yin la /
analyzed: 'gro ba rnams ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa yin pa'i phyir bsgom pas spang par bya ba nyid yin la /
translated: Because the destinies are unobscured-indeterminate, they are objects abandoned by the path of meditation.

original: bsgom pas spang bar bya ba la yang bsgom pas spang bar bya ba dang / phra rgyas kun du 'gro ba rnams rgyas par 'gyur gyi gzhan dag ni ma yin te /
analyzed: bsgom pas spang bar bya ba la yang bsgom pas spang bar bya ba dang / phra rgyas kun du 'gro ba rnams rgyas par 'gyur gyi gzhan dag ni ma yin te /
translated: Also, in objects abandoned by the path of meditation, only those that are objects abandoned by the path of meditation and pervasive negative tendencies increase, not others.

original: de'i phyir thams cad smos pa la lan gdab par bya dgos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir thams cad smos pa la lan gdab par bya dgos so //
translated: Therefore, it is necessary to answer the question, ‚ÄúWhy are all five destinies mentioned?‚Äù

original: rnam pa lnga nyid yin na yang de dag dge ba dang nyon mongs pa can nyid du yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam pa lnga nyid yin na yang de dag dge ba dang nyon mongs pa can nyid du yang 'gyur ro //
translated: Even though they are five, they would also be virtuous and afflicted.

original: 'gro ba rnams su nying mtshams sbyor ba'i sems rnam pa lnga yod de zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung ba dang 'gog pa dang lam mthong bas spang bar bya ba dang / bsgom pas spang bar bya ba rnams so //
analyzed: 'gro ba rnams su nying mtshams sbyor ba'i sems rnam pa lnga yod de zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung ba dang 'gog pa dang lam mthong bas spang bar bya ba dang / bsgom pas spang bar bya ba rnams so //
translated: There are five types of minds that link to the life-stream of beings: those abandoned by seeing the truths of suffering, origin, cessation, and path, and those abandoned by the path of meditation.

original: 'jug pa dang bcas pa'i 'gro ba smos pas zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'jug pa dang bcas pa'i 'gro ba smos pas zhes bya ba la /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúbecause it mentions the life-stream that is accompanied by entry‚Äù means

original: 'dir 'gro ba smos pas ni 'jug pa dang lhan cig pa'i 'gro ba gzung ste /
analyzed: 'dir 'gro ba smos pas ni 'jug pa dang lhan cig pa'i 'gro ba gzung ste /
translated: that the phrase ‚Äúlife-stream‚Äù here includes the life-stream that is accompanied by entry.

original: 'gro ba'i 'jug pa la 'gro ba nye bar btags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'gro ba'i 'jug pa la 'gro ba nye bar btags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because the entry to the life-stream is designated as the life-stream.

original: 'gro ba rnams kyi 'jug pa yang nyid mtshams sbyor ba'i sems dag yin la /
analyzed: 'gro ba rnams kyi 'jug pa yang nyid mtshams sbyor ba'i sems dag yin la /
translated: The entry to the life-stream of beings is the mind that links to the life-stream.

original: nying mtshams sbyor ba'i sems kyi 'og rol gyi ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa'i rgyud la grol ba zhes brjod do //
analyzed: nying mtshams sbyor ba'i sems kyi 'og rol gyi ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa'i rgyud la grol ba zhes brjod do //
translated: The life-stream that is subsequent to the mind that links to the life-stream is called the life-stream that is liberated from obstruction.

original: de dag kyang rnam pa lnga yin pa de'i phyir 'gro ba dag la phra rgyas thams cad rgyas par 'gyur ro zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de dag kyang rnam pa lnga yin pa de'i phyir 'gro ba dag la phra rgyas thams cad rgyas par 'gyur ro zhes gsungs so //
translated: Since that life-stream is of five types, it is said that all the negative tendencies increase in the life-streams of beings.

original: de nyid la dpe smos pa ni grong smos na grong gi nye 'khor yang smos pa bzhin no zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de nyid la dpe smos pa ni grong smos na grong gi nye 'khor yang smos pa bzhin no zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The example is mentioned in the same way that a village is mentioned when its outskirts are meant.

original: ji ltar grong smos na grong gi nye 'khor smos pa yin zhe na /üîΩgrong 'di na s'a lu'i zhing yod do //
analyzed: ji ltar grong smos na grong gi nye 'khor smos pa yin zhe na / grong 'di na s'a lu'i zhing yod do //
translated: How is it that the outskirts of a village are meant when the village is mentioned?

original: 'bru'i zhing yod do zhes smra ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bru'i zhing yod do zhes smra ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is said, ‚ÄúIn this village there is a field of rice, a field of wheat.‚Äù

original: dper na snyigs ma lnga po dag tu zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
analyzed: dper na snyigs ma lnga po dag tu zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
translated: For example, in the five corruptions, etc.

original: tshe dang / bskal ba dang / nyon mongs pa dang / lta ba dang / sems can gyi snyigs ma dag tu'o //
analyzed: tshe dang / bskal ba dang / nyon mongs pa dang / lta ba dang / sems can gyi snyigs ma dag tu'o //
translated: The corruptions of life, of the aeon, of defilement, of views, and of living beings.

original: nyon mongs pa'i rang bzhin du khyad par med kyang nyon mongs pa dag las lta ba'i snyigs ma dag tha dad du gzhag pa ni khyim pa dang rab tu byung ba'i phyogs kyi dbang du mdzad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i rang bzhin du khyad par med kyang nyon mongs pa dag las lta ba'i snyigs ma dag tha dad du gzhag pa ni khyim pa dang rab tu byung ba'i phyogs kyi dbang du mdzad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Although there is no difference in their nature as defilements, the corruption of views is distinguished from the defilements and is mentioned separately because it is related to the lay and monastic sectors.

original: 'gro ba'i rgyu shes par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'gro ba'i rgyu shes par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba la /
translated: In order to know the cause of the world, etc.

original: 'gro ba rnams kyi rgyu ni las kyi srid pa yin te de'i phyir de 'gro ba'i rang bzhin yin yang /
analyzed: 'gro ba rnams kyi rgyu ni las kyi srid pa yin te de'i phyir de 'gro ba'i rang bzhin yin yang /
translated: The cause of beings is karmic existence, and therefore, although it is the nature of beings,

original: 'gro ba'i rgyu shes par bya ba'i phyir tha dad du smos so //
analyzed: 'gro ba'i rgyu shes par bya ba'i phyir tha dad du smos so //
translated: it is mentioned separately in order to show that it is the cause of beings.

original: 'di ni srid pa bar ma la yang thal bar 'gyur @265a * //üîΩro zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'di ni srid pa bar ma la yang thal bar 'gyur @265a * // ro zhes bya ba la /
translated: This would also apply to the intermediate existence.

original: tha dad par smos kyang 'gro ba yin par 'gyur na ni 'gro ba'i rang bzhin kho na 'gro bar shes par bya ba'i phyir tha dad du bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tha dad par smos kyang 'gro ba yin par 'gyur na ni 'gro ba'i rang bzhin kho na 'gro bar shes par bya ba'i phyir tha dad du bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: Even if it is mentioned separately, if it were a realm, then it would be a realm by its very nature, and it would be taught separately in order to show that it is a realm.

original: der 'gro bas na zhes bya ba ni las su bsgrub pa yongs su bzung ba yin no //
analyzed: der 'gro bas na zhes bya ba ni las su bsgrub pa yongs su bzung ba yin no //
translated: Since one goes there, it is a realm.

original: srid par ma la ni de ltar ni rung ste /
analyzed: srid par ma la ni de ltar ni rung ste /
translated: This is acceptable for the intermediate existence,

original: des na 'gro ba ma yin no ;üîΩ/ gzugs med pa rnams kyang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: des na 'gro ba ma yin no ; / gzugs med pa rnams kyang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: but not for the formless realm.

original: gzugs med pa rnams 'gro ba ma yin par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzugs med pa rnams 'gro ba ma yin par 'gyur te /
translated: The formless realm would not be a realm,

original: 'chi 'pho ba'i yul nyid du skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'chi 'pho ba'i yul nyid du skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because one is born in the very place where one dies.

original: 'di ltar gzugs med par nye bar 'gro ba rnams ni gtsug lag khang ngam shing drud ngam bsam gtan bzhi pa'i bar gang du 'chi 'pho ba de nyid du skye bas srid pa bar ma dang 'dra bar 'gro bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar gzugs med par nye bar 'gro ba rnams ni gtsug lag khang ngam shing drud ngam bsam gtan bzhi pa'i bar gang du 'chi 'pho ba de nyid du skye bas srid pa bar ma dang 'dra bar 'gro bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus those who proceed to the formless realm are born in the very place where they die and transmigrate, whether it be a monastery, a forest, or the fourth absorption. They do not proceed like the intermediate beings.

original: de lta na 'o na ni zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de lta na 'o na ni zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If that is so, then,

original: phyogs dang po btang nas phyogs gzhan la brten pa'o //
analyzed: phyogs dang po btang nas phyogs gzhan la brten pa'o //
translated: having abandoned the first position, you are reduced to the second.

original: srid pa bar ma yin pa kho na'i phyir zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: srid pa bar ma yin pa kho na'i phyir zhes bya ba la /
translated: Because it is an intermediate existence.

original: gang nas 'chi 'pho ba dang gang du 'gro bar 'gyur ba de gnyis kyi bar du 'byung ba'i phyir srid pa bar ma yin no ;
analyzed: gang nas 'chi 'pho ba dang gang du 'gro bar 'gyur ba de gnyis kyi bar du 'byung ba'i phyir srid pa bar ma yin no ;
translated: It is an intermediate existence because it occurs between the place where one dies and the place where one is reborn.

original: / srid ba bar ma ni 'gro ba'i bar ma do yin na 'gro ba'i bar ma do ni 'gro bar mi rung ngo //
analyzed: / srid ba bar ma ni 'gro ba'i bar ma do yin na 'gro ba'i bar ma do ni 'gro bar mi rung ngo //
translated: If the intermediate existence is the intermediate state of the reincarnating beings, then it is not tenable that the intermediate state of the reincarnating beings is a reincarnating being.

original: gal te 'gro ba rnams dge ba dang nyon mongs pa can yang yin na /
analyzed: gal te 'gro ba rnams dge ba dang nyon mongs pa can yang yin na /
translated: If the reincarnating beings are virtuous and afflicted,

original: rnam par smin pa grub nas zhes bya ba 'di ji ltar drang zhe na /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa grub nas zhes bya ba 'di ji ltar drang zhe na /
translated: how can you interpret the statement, ‚ÄúWhen the karmic maturation is established‚Äù?

original: rnam par smin pa grub nas dge ba dang nyon mongs pa can yang dmyal ba zhes bya ba'i grangs su 'gro bas 'gal ba med de /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa grub nas dge ba dang nyon mongs pa can yang dmyal ba zhes bya ba'i grangs su 'gro bas 'gal ba med de /
translated: and when the karmic maturation is established, it is virtuous or afflicted, it is not contradictory for it to be counted as a hell being.
